DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Organ System Metastatic Involvement Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the status or number of organ systems, anatomical structures that consist of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions, with evidence of the spread of cancer from a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic cells.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Organ System Metastatic Involvement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to evidence of the spread of cancer from a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic cells to an organ system, an anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.  Representative examples are the gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and hematopoietic system.:A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.  Representative examples are the gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and hematopoietic system.
A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: updated for ISO compliance during revisions to provide naming consistency for related elements

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the condition or state of organ system involvement at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Greater than one organ system involved with metastatic disease.
One organ system involved with metastatic disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A condition or state at a particular time.
